alert.note: Alert for Putnam; White (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 16 at 11:16PM CST until February 17 at 1:30AM CST by NWS Nashville
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 215 AM CST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Middle Tennessee, including the following counties, Putnam and White. * WHEN...Until 215 AM CST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1116 PM CST, trained weather spotters reported heavy rain in the advisory area due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Between 1 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Cookeville, Sparta, Algood, Monterey, Hamptons Crossroads, Bakers Crossroads and Burgess Falls State Park. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
